unnormalised: Hey everyone, someone asked about the different govt IDs we need in India, so thought I'd share what I know! It can be a bit confusing, especially for new citizens or people moving here.
normalised: Hey everyone, someone asked about the different government I-Ds we need in India, so thought I'd share what I know! It can be a bit confusing, especially for new citizens or people moving here.

unnormalised: First off, you absolutely need an Aadhaar card. It's that 12-digit number (something like 1234-5678-9012) and it's used for basically everything – bank accounts, SIM cards, even getting gas subsidies. Keep it safe! Also, it's linked to your biometrics.
normalised: First off, you absolutely need an Aadhaar card. It's that twelve-digit number (something like one two three four dash five six seven eight dash nine zero one two) and it's used for basically everything – bank accounts, S-I-M cards, even getting gas subsidies. Keep it safe! Also, it's linked to your biometrics.

unnormalised: Next up is the PAN card. This is a 10-character alphanumeric identifier (like ABCDE1234F) that's super important for financial transactions, especially anything involving taxes. If you're earning money or investing, you'll need this. You can apply online, it's pretty straightforward, just keep your Aadhar ready.
normalised: Next up is the P-A-N card. This is a ten-character alphanumeric identifier (like A-B-C-D-E one two three four F) that's super important for financial transactions, especially anything involving taxes. If you're earning money or investing, you'll need this. You can apply online, it's pretty straightforward, just keep your Aadhar ready.

unnormalised: Then there's the Voter ID, officially called the Electoral Photo Identity Card (EPIC). It looks like EPIC0000000, something like that. This is necessary to vote in any election. Very important for exercising our democratic right! Make sure your address and other details are up-to-date with Election commision of India.
normalised: Then there's the Voter I-D, officially called the Electoral Photo Identity Card (E-P-I-C). It looks like E-P-I-C zero zero zero zero zero zero zero, something like that. This is necessary to vote in any election. Very important for exercising our democratic right! Make sure your address and other details are up-to-date with Election commission of India.

unnormalised: Don’t forget the driver’s license. While it is required for driving a vehicle on the roads, it also works as a valid photo ID. It is issued by the regional transport office (RTO). A typical driving license number may look like UP1620020045678. You will be required to pass a driving test to get your license.
normalised: Don’t forget the driver’s license. While it is required for driving a vehicle on the roads, it also works as a valid photo I-D. It is issued by the regional transport office (R-T-O). A typical driving license number may look like U-P one six two zero zero two zero zero four five six seven eight. You will be required to pass a driving test to get your license.
